page.title: 15RECREATION 1.
page.content: The population of Crawford village is mainly retired folk and in their leisure time they have bingo and dominoes which are played in the village pavilion. This wooden building was built and put up by the villagers themselves. There is also a Derby and Joan Club who arrange trips. People go to the Weslyan Chapel and others to the Mission but attendance has fallen as the older people die. The Crawford Arms public house plays an important part in the life of the community. Until recent years the village had a football team. The Villagers raised 400 pounds to provide swings, a roundabout and slide for a childrens play park.
